Judul: TOWARD A GENDER-BALANCED ORGANIZATION :EXPLORING MASCULINITY AND FEMININITY EMBEDDED IN AN INDONESIAN STATE-OWNED COMPANY
Abstrak:
An organization that is gender-biased on the inside is arguably incapable of  

producing gender-equitable outcomes, which often hold back those with gender 

disadvantage to grow in the organization. Understanding whether and how an 

organization is Ã‚Â“genderedÃ‚Â” should be seen from its deep structure that underlies the 

systemic factors that set the way of working in the organization. Given the low 

number of women present in the executive position in PT. MUSIA arguably 

indicating that the organization is a masculine organization, the researchers aim to 

understand how gendered the organization is by exploring the masculinity and 

femininity of the organization seen through three related lenses: the core (expected) 

behaviours, working environment, and performance appraisal. Using a mix of 

qualitative and quantitative methods, the researchers used in-depth interview to 

explore employeesÃ‚Â’ interpretation toward the organizationÃ‚Â’s core behaviours, 

observation to understand the working environment, and survey to assess the 

gender traits embedded in the performance appraisal indicators. Based on the 

overall analysis across the three related aspects of the organization, PT. MUSIA is 

shown to be a masculine-inclined organization. The outcome of this research is a 

proposal for improvement in its system to have a more gender-balanced system for 

the organization.
